info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 22 at 9:26PM CDT until April 22 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock TX
info.description:
FFWLUB
The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Lamb County in northwestern Texas...
* Until 1045 PM CDT.
* At 926 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated nearly stationary thunderstorms producing heavy rain across a small section of Lamb County northeast of Littlefield near the community of Fieldton. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past several hours. Additional rainfall amounts over 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fieldton and Spade.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Blackwater Draw.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
